bug.author: Mistobaan
bug.description:
I want to be able to run tensorboard in development mode and make some changes. from the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tensorboard/DEVELOPMENT.md>DEVELOPMENT document:</denchmark-link>
bazel run third_party/tensorflow/tensorboard/components/tf_tensorboard:demo
but this command seems to be obsolete from the directory structure (there is no target inside /third_party). also seems there is a .idea folder committed in the repository. Would be nice to know how the core team setups their environment.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/master/README.md#usage>The README.md is currently up-to-date.</denchmark-link> We should, as you indicate, update . I'll just go ahead and do this in our new repository at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard</denchmark-link> . Thanks for reporting. As to development environments, it's just everyone's own taste; we don't have a single unified setup. In fact, we're all quite different: I believe we've got Linux with vim, Linux/Mac with Sublime, Linux on emacs/IntelliJ, and using a Google-internal web IDE. :-)
